description: Service agreement language tightening - Replace vague terms with specific requirements

input_files.description: Basic service agreement with vague, flexible language that needs to be made specific and legally binding
input_files.content_summary: Generic service agreement with 4 sections: General Provisions, Deliverables, Confidentiality, and Termination. Uses weak language like 'should', 'may', 'can be negotiated'.

fallback_files.description: Mandatory requirements document specifying what must/shall/required language to add
fallback_files.content_summary: Requirements document with 3 sections: Mandatory Requirements (deadlines, approvals, reporting), Prohibited Activities (subcontracting, confidentiality breaches), and Additional Requirements (standards, payment, dispute resolution).

expected_files.description: Service agreement with tracked changes applied based on fallback requirements
expected_files.status: TBD - needs to be created by user

expected_changes.old_text: should be completed in a reasonable timeframe
expected_changes.new_text: must be completed within 30 business days of project start
expected_changes.requirement_source: 1.1 The Contractor must complete all work within 30 business days

expected_changes.old_text: The Contractor may use subcontractors at their discretion
expected_changes.new_text: Subcontracting is prohibited without prior written approval from the Client
expected_changes.requirement_source: 2.1 Subcontracting is prohibited without prior written approval

expected_changes.old_text: Payment terms are flexible and can be negotiated
expected_changes.new_text: Payment shall be made within 15 days of invoice submission
expected_changes.reason: Add specific payment terms per requirement 3.2
expected_changes.requirement_source: 3.2 Payment shall be made within 15 days of invoice submission

expected_changes.old_text: The Contractor will deliver work products as agreed
expected_changes.new_text: All deliverables shall be reviewed and approved by the Client before final acceptance
expected_changes.requirement_source: 1.2 All deliverables shall be reviewed and approved by the Client

expected_changes.new_text: All work must meet industry best practices and professional standards
expected_changes.requirement_source: 3.1 All work must meet industry best practices

expected_changes.old_text: Documentation may be provided if requested
expected_changes.new_text: The Contractor is required to provide weekly progress reports to the Client
expected_changes.requirement_source: 1.3 The Contractor is required to provide weekly progress reports

expected_changes.old_text: Both parties should maintain confidentiality of sensitive information
expected_changes.new_text: Both parties must maintain confidentiality of sensitive information
expected_changes.requirement_source: 2.2 The Contractor must not share confidential information

expected_changes.old_text: Information can be shared with authorized personnel
expected_changes.new_text: Information must not be shared with unauthorized parties
expected_changes.reason: Add prohibition on unauthorized sharing per requirement 2.2
expected_changes.requirement_source: 2.2 The Contractor must not share confidential information with unauthorized parties

expected_changes.old_text: Confidential data will be protected as appropriate
expected_changes.new_text: Confidential data must be protected according to industry standards

expected_changes.old_text: Either party may terminate this agreement with notice
expected_changes.new_text: The agreement must include a clause for dispute resolution through mediation before termination
expected_changes.reason: Add dispute resolution requirement per requirement 3.3
expected_changes.requirement_source: 3.3 The agreement must include a clause for dispute resolution through mediation

known_issues: System may struggle with matching 'can be negotiated' phrase
Might miss changes that span multiple words or sentences
May have difficulty with context-dependent replacements
notes: This is the primary test case for basic fallback document processing. It tests the system's ability to extract requirements from a fallback document and apply them as tracked changes to a vague contract. Expected to be challenging due to the need for contextual understanding of where requirements should be applied.
